meanings.definition: The quality of being difficult to understand or comprehend.
meanings.sent1: The abstrusities of quantum physics can leave many students feeling confused.
meanings.sent2: The professor's lecture on abstrusities in literature was challenging but enlightening.
meanings.sent3: Trying to explain the abstrusities of emojis to my grandparents was quite a task!
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a maze of abstrusities, each thought more complex than the last.
meanings.sent5: The abstrusities of the ancient language were like a puzzle waiting to be solved.

meanings.definition: Something that is obscure or hard to grasp.
meanings.sent1: The abstrusities of the ancient artifact puzzled the archaeologists.
meanings.sent2: The mystery novel was full of abstrusities that kept the readers guessing until the end.
meanings.sent3: The abstrusities of the new video game made it even more exciting to play.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts were like abstrusities, hidden in the depths of his mind.
meanings.sent5: The abstrusities of the riddle were finally unraveled by the clever detective.
